data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341589,"name":"Tharun","username":"thaMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T00:20:49.986Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eOur through bore encoder is connected to an axle holding two 18T sprockets which connect to the 64 tooth sprockets on our arm. We have set our zero position at the passive resting point of the robot arm, and have also implemented a manual reset button on our controller. With this setup, our encoder is working reading values from 0-1500, however once it passes -900 the encoder resets back to zero. Any advice on what to do\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T00:20:49.986Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":93.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459856,"topic_slug":"encoder-reset-issue","display_username":"Tharun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57591,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/encoder-reset-issue/459856/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3341621,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T01:31:05.435Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYou’re using it as an absolute encoder I assume. To confirm the encoder is on a shaft that is 18:64 ratio to the actual mechanism? If absolute it only tracks within a single rotation so if u go beyond that it will be back at the beginning.
